content:
The provided code chunk adds two menu commands to a labelMenu in a graphical user interface (GUI) application. These commands allow users to jump directly to the start ('Jump To Zero') or end ('Jump To End Time') of an animation timeline within an animation panel. This functionality is particularly useful for quickly navigating through animations, especially when dealing with complex timelines or multiple actors.

The `labelMenu` appears to be part of a custom GUI component (AnimPanel) designed for managing and controlling animations. The added commands enhance user interaction by providing quick-access options to reset the timeline position, which can improve efficiency during animation editing or playback.

In the broader context of the application, these menu additions contribute to the overall usability of the animation panel, making it easier for users to control and navigate through their animations efficiently.

```python
# The following code adds two commands to a menu in an animation panel:
labelMenu.add_

labelMenu.add_command(label = 'Jump To Zero',
                              command = self.resetToZero)
        labelMenu.add_command(label = 'Jump To End Time',
                              command = self.resetToEnd)
